## Choosing Among Models Using the Validation Set Approach and Cross-Validation
## Code Chunk 15
```{r}
set.seed(1)

train = sample(c(TRUE,FALSE),nrow(Hitters),rep=T)


summary(train)

test = (!train)
```

## Code Chunk 16
```{r}
regfit.best = regsubsets(Salary~.,data = Hitters[train,], nvmax = 19)

test.mat = model.matrix(Salary~.,data=Hitters[test,])

test.mat
```

## Code Chunk 17
```{r}

val.errors = rep(NA,19)

val.errors

coefi = coef(regfit.best, 7)

coefi

names(coefi)

test.mat[,names(coefi)]

pred = test.mat[,names(coefi)]%*%coefi

pred
```

## Code Chunk 18
```{r}

for(i in 1:19){

  coefi = coef(regfit.best, id = i)
  pred = test.mat[,names(coefi)]%*%coefi
  val.errors[i] = mean((Hitters$Salary[test]-pred)^2)  
}

val.errors

which.min(val.errors)

coef(regfit.best,7)
```



##Our Own Predict Function!!!
## Code Chunk 20
```{r}

predict.regsubsets = function(object,newdata,id){
   form=as.formula(object$call[[2]])
   mat=model.matrix(form,newdata)
   coefi=coef(object,id=id)
   xvars=names(coefi)
   mat[,xvars]%*%coefi
}
```

## Code Chunk 21
```{r}
k = 10

set.seed(1)


folds = sample(k, nrow(Hitters),replace=T)

folds

summary(folds)

cv.errors = matrix(NA,k,19,dimnames=list(paste(1:10),paste(1:19)))

cv.errors
```


## Code Chunk 22
```{r}

for(j in 1:k){
   best.fit = regsubsets(Salary~.,data = Hitters[folds!=j,], nvmax=19)
   for(i in 1:19){
      pred=predict(best.fit,Hitters[folds==j,],id = i)
      cv.errors[j,i]= mean((Hitters$Salary[folds==j]-pred)^2)
   }

}

cv.errors

best.fit$call[[2]]
```



## Code Chunk 23
```{r}
mean.cv.errors = apply(cv.errors,2,mean)

mean.cv.errors

which.min(mean.cv.errors)

plot(mean.cv.errors)
```
